main event: A silver saucer-shaped object was observed intermittently in the clouds by multiple witnesses in Cherry Creek, New York on August 19, 1965.
interesting points: The object was described as 25-30 ft long and 20 ft thick, emitting red glowing streamers and causing unusual AM radio interference., Several youths, aged 13-16, witnessed the sighting and reported their observations remained consistent upon cross-examination., The sighting resulted in a noticeable reduction in milk production from cows, and disturbances among local livestock., An oily purple substance was found at the site, though it is not believed to be connected to the sighting., The sighting's conclusion was classified as unidentified by the Air Force, with no physical evidence or conventional explanation found.
sighted object: a silver saucer-shaped object emitting red glowing streamers
witness description: youths aged 13-16, with their parents also interviewed regarding their credibility
